intro: Bellucia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bellucia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Bellucia brasiliensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of the rainforest, providing habitat and food for various insect species.
